definition: shift working
wheel/disk/ring/steamship/to take turns/to rotate/by turn/classifier for big round objects: disk, or recurring events: round, turn
team/class/squad/work shift/ranking/CL:個|个[ge4]/classifier for groups
surname Ban

sentences.english: Able to work under pressure, working independently, willingness to work overtime or work with shift.
sentences.chinese: 具抗压性，能独立作业，并配合加班及轮班。

sentences.english: But the turnaround times for such shifts can be brutal.
sentences.chinese: 但是这种轮班制却也非常残酷。

sentences.english: Data of other words can be removed by a negative-going transition on the shift-out input.
sentences.chinese: 其他文字数据可以去除对轮班进行输入的负向过渡。

sentences.english: The whole world could be on eight-hour shifts.
sentences.chinese: 整个世界都可以实行八小时轮班制。

sentences.english: The face of disturbances spread, the deployment of 24-hour police shifts Vian.
sentences.chinese: 面对骚乱蔓延，当局部署全天24小时警察轮班维安。

sentences.english: Financial stress and odd-hour work shifts can play roles in sleeplessness, too, Chervin added.
sentences.chinese: 谢尔文还指出，经济压力以及轮班制也会导致失眠。

sentences.english: Job sharing means that two people divide the work usually assigned to one person.
sentences.chinese: 轮班制就是二个人轮流做一份通常由一人做的工作。

sentences.english: What do you mean, different shift systems?
sentences.chinese: 不同的轮班制，你指的是？

sentences.english: Controllers are required to have eight hours of rest between shifts, the FAA said.
sentences.chinese: 联邦航空部还要求每个轮班之间必须保证八小时休息。

sentences.english: A miner picked up safety supplies before his shift.
sentences.chinese: 一位矿工在轮班前戴上安全装备。

sentences.english: Job-sharing is still a novel concept and it will take a while for employers to get used to it.
sentences.chinese: 轮班制仍然是一个空想，要花一些功夫雇员才能适应。

sentences.english: Regardless of gender, crews were kept busy during their 24-hour shifts.
sentences.chinese: 不论男女，24小时的轮班中他们都十分的忙碌。

sentences.english: So Aflac started offering flexible schedules and job sharing.
sentences.chinese: 有鉴于此，该公司开始实行灵活的工作时间和轮班制。

sentences.english: We immediately organized into shock groups to work by shifts on repairing the dyke.
sentences.chinese: 我们立即组成突击小组轮班进行堤坝的抢修工作。

sentences.english: Pilots on long-haul flights often take turns at the controls to remain alert.
sentences.chinese: 飞行员往往在长途飞行中轮班以保持清醒。

definition: to change shift/the next work shift/to relieve (a workman on the previous shift)/to take over the job
three-shift system (work rostering)
(of a security guard etc) to be on duty, keeping an eye on things/to keep watch
to arrange (shifts, runs, classes etc) in order
to change shifts/to work in turns
on night duty
to be on all-night duty/to be on night watch/to keep a vigil
to work a shift/on duty
on call/always available/ready at all times
variant of 執勤|执勤[zhi2 qin2]
day shift
lit. to continuously revolve/to work non-stop/to work around the clock (idiom)
to reinforce/to dispatch troops
night shift
to take turns on duty
to nurse/to look after/to watch over/(old) hospital nurse
